abstract: As the market shifts away from carbonated beverages, Pepsi’s move unwinds a decade-long strategy of separating bottling from its main soft-drink business.
snippet: As the market shifts away from carbonated beverages, Pepsi’s move unwinds a decade-long strategy of separating bottling from its main soft-drink business.
lead_paragraph: PepsiCo said early Monday it was offering to buy all remaining shares in its two main bottlers for about $6 billion, in a move that unwinds its decade-long strategy of separating bottling from its main soft-drink business.

headline.main: Pepsi Offers to Buy All Shares of 2 Main Bottlers
headline.print_headline: Pepsi Offers to Buy All Shares of Its 2 Main Bottlers

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
